cards.name: Adarkar Valkyrie
cards.text:
Flying, vigilance
{T}: When target creature other than Adarkar Valkyrie dies this turn, return that card to the battlefield under your control.
cards.flavor: She doesn't escort the dead to the afterlife, but instead raises them to fight and die again.

cards.name: Adarkar Windform
cards.text:
Flying
{1}{S}: Target creature loses flying until end of turn. ({S} can be paid with one mana from a snow permanent.)
cards.flavor: Terisiare has only two kinds of weather: cold and weird.

cards.name: Allosaurus Rider
cards.text:
You may exile two green cards from your hand rather than pay Allosaurus Rider's mana cost.
Allosaurus Rider's power and toughness are each equal to 1 plus the number of lands you control.

cards.name: Arctic Flats
cards.text:
Arctic Flats enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {G} or {W} to your mana pool.
cards.flavor:
"A realm once green now ruled by Frost,
Where flesh and field both pay its cost.
Those dearly loved, forever lost . . ."
—The Dynasty of Winter Kings

cards.name: Arctic Nishoba
cards.text:
Trample
Cumulative upkeep {G} or {W} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
When Arctic Nishoba dies, you gain 2 life for each age counter on it.

cards.name: Arcum Dagsson
cards.text: {T}: Target artifact creature's controller sacrifices it. That player may search his or her library for a noncreature artifact card, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle his or her library.
cards.flavor: "Artifice sundered the world. It shall not again wreak such sorrow."

cards.name: Aurochs Herd
cards.text:
Trample
When Aurochs Herd enters the battlefield, you may search your library for an Aurochs card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.
Whenever Aurochs Herd attacks, it gets +1/+0 until end of turn for each other attacking Aurochs.

cards.name: Balduvian Fallen
cards.text:
Cumulative upkeep {1} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
Whenever Balduvian Fallen's cumulative upkeep is paid, it gets +1/+0 until end of turn for each {B} or {R} spent this way.

cards.name: Balduvian Frostwaker
cards.text: {U}, {T}: Target snow land becomes a 2/2 blue Elemental creature with flying. It's still a land.
cards.flavor: "Whether frozen or fertile, the land is our ally. It awaits the call to battle."

cards.name: Balduvian Rage
cards.text:
Target attacking creature gets +X/+0 until end of turn.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
cards.flavor:
"Let your heartbeat be the thunder in the valley. Let your swords be the lightning on the peaks."
—Lothar Lovisason, Balduvian chieftain

cards.name: Balduvian Warlord
cards.text: {T}: Remove target blocking creature from combat. Creatures it was blocking that hadn't become blocked by another creature this combat become unblocked, then it blocks an attacking creature of your choice. Activate this ability only during the declare blockers step.

cards.name: Blizzard Specter
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Blizzard Specter deals combat damage to a player, choose one —
• That player returns a permanent he or she controls to its owner's hand.
• That player discards a card.

cards.name: Boreal Centaur
cards.text: {S}: Boreal Centaur gets +1/+1 until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn. ({S} can be paid with one mana from a snow permanent.)
cards.flavor: Those who used reindeer as beasts of burden knew to avoid the centaurs, who raged at the enslavement of their spirit-kin.

cards.name: Boreal Druid
cards.text: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
cards.flavor: Some creatures are bound to the cold by Rimewind magic. Others seek it out, adapted by two thousand years of the Ice. The Boreal, where Heidar's frigid sway is strongest, is home to both.

cards.name: Boreal Griffin
cards.text:
Flying
{S}: Boreal Griffin gains first strike until end of turn. ({S} can be paid with one mana from a snow permanent.)
cards.flavor:
"More than snow falls from the Boreal skies."
—Arkin Egilsson, skycaptain

cards.name: Boreal Shelf
cards.text:
Boreal Shelf enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {W} or {U} to your mana pool.
cards.flavor:
"Who will stay the Tyrant's hand,
As ice and woe both grip our land?
The helpless feel his frozen brand."
—The Dynasty of Winter Kings

cards.name: Braid of Fire
cards.text: Cumulative upkeep—Add {R} to your mana pool. (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
cards.flavor: "To a trained mind, the cold is but a momentary distraction."

cards.name: Brooding Saurian
cards.text: At the beginning of each end step, each player gains control of all nontoken permanents he or she owns.
cards.flavor:
"I have been trapped in the lizard's lair for days. It seems to regard me as its child and will not let me leave."
—Aevar Borg, northern guide, journal entry

cards.name: Bull Aurochs
cards.text:
Trample
Whenever Bull Aurochs attacks, it gets +1/+0 until end of turn for each other attacking Aurochs.
cards.flavor: The aurochs herd is content to graze—until the bull provides the dissenting urge to charge.

cards.name: Chill to the Bone
cards.text: Destroy target nonsnow creature.
cards.flavor:
"Thick hides and layered armor won't help when I freeze you from the inside out."
—Heidar, Rimewind master

cards.name: Chilling Shade
cards.text:
Flying
{S}: Chilling Shade gets +1/+1 until end of turn. ({S} can be paid with one mana from a snow permanent.)
cards.flavor: Rimewind necromancers caught travelers in mystical blizzards then trapped their spirits in the mist of their final frozen breaths.

cards.name: Coldsteel Heart
cards.text:
Coldsteel Heart enters the battlefield tapped.
As Coldsteel Heart enters the battlefield, choose a color.
{T}: Add one mana of the chosen color to your mana pool.
cards.flavor: The Phyrexian death machine awoke, its coldsteel heart imbuing it with sinister new power.

cards.name: Commandeer
cards.text:
You may exile two blue cards from your hand rather than pay Commandeer's mana cost.
Gain control of target noncreature spell. You may choose new targets for it. (If that spell is an artifact, enchantment, or planeswalker, the permanent enters the battlefield under your control.)

cards.name: Controvert
cards.text:
Counter target spell.
Recover {2}{U}{U} (When a creature is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, you may pay {2}{U}{U}. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand. Otherwise, exile this card.)

cards.name: Counterbalance
cards.text: Whenever an opponent casts a spell, you may reveal the top card of your library. If you do, counter that spell if it has the same converted mana cost as the revealed card.

cards.name: Cover of Winter
cards.text:
Cumulative upkeep {S} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it. {S} can be paid with one mana from a snow permanent.)
If a creature would deal combat damage to you and/or one or more creatures you control, prevent X of that damage, where X is the number of age counters on Cover of Winter.
{S}: Put an age counter on Cover of Winter.

cards.name: Cryoclasm
cards.text: Destroy target Plains or Island. Cryoclasm deals 3 damage to that land's controller.
cards.flavor: The people of Terisiare had come to live on frozen fields as though on solid ground. Nothing reminded them of the difference more clearly than the rifts brought on by the Thaw.

cards.name: Darien, King of Kjeldor
cards.text: Whenever you're dealt damage, you may put that many 1/1 white Soldier creature tokens onto the battlefield.
cards.flavor:
"With his dream of unification fulfilled, Darien became the last king of Kjeldor. Those who followed were known as the kings of New Argive."
—Kjeldor: Ice Civilization

cards.name: Dark Depths
cards.text:
Dark Depths enters the battlefield with ten ice counters on it.
{3}: Remove an ice counter from Dark Depths.
When Dark Depths has no ice counters on it, sacrifice it. If you do, put a legendary 20/20 black Avatar creature token with flying and indestructible named Marit Lage onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Deathmark
cards.text: Destroy target green or white creature.
cards.flavor:
"I hope it's true that every snowflake is unique, because I never want to see one like this again. Now clean up that body."
—Thangbrand Gyrdsson, Kjeldoran patrol

cards.name: Deepfire Elemental
cards.text: {X}{X}{1}: Destroy target artifact or creature with converted mana cost X.
cards.flavor:
"There are deep, deep places in this world that have long burned hot with little regard for the whitening of the earth's thin skin."
—Sek'Kuar, Deathkeeper

cards.name: Diamond Faerie
cards.text:
Flying
{1}{S}: Snow creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn. ({S} can be paid with one mana from a snow permanent.)
cards.flavor:
"That such delicate creatures could become so powerful in the embrace of winter is yet more proof that I am right."
—Heidar, Rimewind master

cards.name: Disciple of Tevesh Szat
cards.text:
{T}: Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
{4}{B}{B}, {T}, Sacrifice Disciple of Tevesh Szat: Target creature gets -6/-6 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "You pray to Freyalise, but she cannot hear your pleas. It is Tevesh Szat who will claim your soul."

cards.name: Drelnoch
cards.text: Whenever Drelnoch becomes blocked, you may draw two cards.
cards.flavor: Adarkar's blank wastes make the mind wander—and stray thoughts are quickly caught and devoured.

cards.name: Earthen Goo
cards.text:
Trample
Cumulative upkeep {R} or {G} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
Earthen Goo gets +1/+1 for each age counter on it.

cards.name: Feast of Flesh
cards.text: Feast of Flesh deals X damage to target creature and you gain X life, where X is 1 plus the number of cards named Feast of Flesh in all graveyards.
cards.flavor:
"Starving an army that feeds on its enemies is a sound strategy."
—Garza Zol, plague queen

cards.name: Field Marshal
cards.text: Other Soldier creatures get +1/+1 and have first strike. (They deal combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
cards.flavor: The Knights of Stromgald struck Darien's Roost from two sides. They would have caught Kjeldor in a pincer attack were it not for Darien's tacticians.

cards.name: Flashfreeze
cards.text: Counter target red or green spell.
cards.flavor:
"Nature? Fire? Bah! Both are chaotic and difficult to control. Ice is structured, latticed, light as a feather, massive as a glacier. In ice, there is power!"
—Heidar, Rimewind master

cards.name: Freyalise's Radiance
cards.text:
Cumulative upkeep {2} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
Snow permanents don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.

cards.name: Frost Marsh
cards.text:
Frost Marsh enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {U} or {B} to your mana pool.
cards.flavor:
"Now caged in Winter's bitter chill,
Our people cry, their voices shrill—
Eternal cold breaks down their will."
—The Dynasty of Winter Kings

cards.name: Frost Raptor
cards.text:
Flying
{S}{S}: Frost Raptor gains shroud until end of turn. ({S} can be paid with one mana from a snow permanent. A creature with shroud can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
cards.flavor: The Rimewind wizards strove to perpetuate a magical winter. Their unnatural snows birthed unnatural beasts.

cards.name: Frostweb Spider
cards.text:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
Whenever Frostweb Spider blocks a creature with flying, put a +1/+1 counter on Frostweb Spider at end of combat.
cards.flavor: Its white webs glitter, mimicking the frost on the tree's branches.

cards.name: Frozen Solid
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
When enchanted creature is dealt damage, destroy it.
cards.flavor:
"Guard, fetch me a mallet."
—Heidar, Rimewind master

cards.name: Fury of the Horde
cards.text:
You may exile two red cards from your hand rather than pay Fury of the Horde's mana cost.
Untap all creatures that attacked this turn. After this main phase, there is an additional combat phase followed by an additional main phase.

cards.name: Garza Zol, Plague Queen
cards.text:
Flying, haste
Whenever a creature dealt damage by Garza Zol, Plague Queen this turn dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Garza Zol.
Whenever Garza Zol deals combat damage to a player, you may draw a card.

cards.name: Garza's Assassin
cards.text:
Sacrifice Garza's Assassin: Destroy target nonblack creature.
Recover—Pay half your life, rounded up. (When another creature is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, you may pay half your life, rounded up. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand. Otherwise, exile this card.)

cards.name: Gelid Shackles
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't block, and its activated abilities can't be activated.
{S}: Enchanted creature gains defender until end of turn. ({S} can be paid with one mana from a snow permanent.)

cards.name: Glacial Plating
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Cumulative upkeep {S} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it. {S} can be paid with one mana from a snow permanent.)
Enchanted creature gets +3/+3 for each age counter on Glacial Plating.

cards.name: Goblin Furrier
cards.text: Prevent all damage that Goblin Furrier would deal to snow creatures.
cards.flavor: Clambering up and over the powdery slope, the goblin chanced upon a small furry thing. There they regarded each other: the goblin and his new pair of earmuffs.

cards.name: Goblin Rimerunner
cards.text:
{T}: Target creature can't block this turn.
{S}: Goblin Rimerunner gains haste until end of turn. ({S} can be paid with one mana from a snow permanent.)
cards.flavor: Rimerunners set off avalanches to immobilize foes as well as to create more challenging slopes.

cards.name: Greater Stone Spirit
cards.text:
Greater Stone Spirit can't be blocked by creatures with flying.
{2}{R}: Until end of turn, target creature gets +0/+2 and gains "{R}: This creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn."
cards.flavor: Having charted their way up the difficult face, the two mountaineers had to contend with the mountain's decision to stand up.

cards.name: Grim Harvest
cards.text:
Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
Recover {2}{B} (When a creature is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, you may pay {2}{B}. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand. Otherwise, exile this card.)

cards.name: Gristle Grinner
cards.text: Whenever a creature dies, Gristle Grinner gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"There it was, clawing the ice as it chittered and clicked its teeth. We fled in horror before it unearthed its grisly meal."
—Aevar Borg, northern guide, journal entry

cards.name: Gutless Ghoul
cards.text: {1}, Sacrifice a creature: You gain 2 life.
cards.flavor:
"Make sure those wretches feed only upon the plagued. The blood of the healthy is reserved for me alone."
—Garza Zol, plague queen

cards.name: Haakon, Stromgald Scourge
cards.text:
You may cast Haakon, Stromgald Scourge from your graveyard, but not from anywhere else.
As long as Haakon is on the battlefield, you may play Knight cards from your graveyard.
When Haakon dies, you lose 2 life.

cards.name: Heidar, Rimewind Master
cards.text: {2}, {T}: Return target permanent to its owner's hand. Activate this ability only if you control four or more snow permanents.
cards.flavor: "The umber stain of the Thaw will be bleached away. Once again the world will be sharp, white, perfect!"

cards.name: Herald of Leshrac
cards.text:
Flying
Cumulative upkeep—Gain control of a land you don't control. (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
Herald of Leshrac gets +1/+1 for each land you control but don't own.
When Herald of Leshrac leaves the battlefield, each player gains control of each land he or she owns that you control.

cards.name: Hibernation's End
cards.text:
Cumulative upkeep {1} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
Whenever you pay Hibernation's End's cumulative upkeep, you may search your library for a creature card with converted mana cost equal to the number of age counters on Hibernation's End and put it onto the battlefield. If you do, shuffle your library.

cards.name: Highland Weald
cards.text:
Highland Weald enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {R} or {G} to your mana pool.
cards.flavor:
"Our noble land, enslaved by Rime,
Is it our fate to freeze through time?
If this be true, oh wicked crime."
—The Dynasty of Winter Kings

cards.name: Icefall
cards.text:
Destroy target artifact or land.
Recover {R}{R} (When a creature is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, you may pay {R}{R}. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand. Otherwise, exile this card.)
cards.flavor: As the Thaw met Terisiare, mountains shed their icy skins, crushing homes and hopes alike.

cards.name: Into the North
cards.text: Search your library for a snow land card and put it onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor:
"Our border lands fall under the grip of Heidar's second winter. Go forth and reclaim them for Yavimaya."
—Kaysa, elder druid of the Juniper Order

cards.name: Jester's Scepter
cards.text:
When Jester's Scepter enters the battlefield, exile the top five cards of target player's library face down. You may look at those cards for as long as they remain exiled.
{2}, {T}, Put a card exiled with Jester's Scepter into its owner's graveyard: Counter target spell if it has the same name as that card.

cards.name: Jokulmorder
cards.text:
Trample
Jokulmorder enters the battlefield tapped.
When Jokulmorder enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you sacrifice five lands.
Jokulmorder doesn't untap during your untap step.
Whenever you play an Island, you may untap Jokulmorder.

cards.name: Jötun Grunt
cards.text: Cumulative upkeep—Put two cards from a single graveyard on the bottom of their owner's library. (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)

cards.name: Jötun Owl Keeper
cards.text:
Cumulative upkeep {W} or {U} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
When Jötun Owl Keeper dies, put a 1/1 white Bird creature token with flying onto the battlefield for each age counter on it.

cards.name: Juniper Order Ranger
cards.text: Whenever another creature enters the battlefield under your control, put a +1/+1 counter on that creature and a +1/+1 counter on Juniper Order Ranger.
cards.flavor: To protect the alliance between Kjeldor and Yavimaya, they trained in the ways of both.

cards.name: Karplusan Minotaur
cards.text:
Cumulative upkeep—Flip a coin. (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
Whenever you win a coin flip, Karplusan Minotaur deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
Whenever you lose a coin flip, Karplusan Minotaur deals 1 damage to target creature or player of an opponent's choice.

cards.name: Karplusan Strider
cards.text: Karplusan Strider can't be the target of blue or black spells.
cards.flavor: The strider's long, loping gait is an adaptation that allows it to move quickly in deep snow.

cards.name: Karplusan Wolverine
cards.text: Whenever Karplusan Wolverine becomes blocked, you may have it deal 1 damage to target creature or player.
cards.flavor:
"They're not easily trained. Fortunately, they already know how to kill."
—Lovisa Coldeyes, Balduvian chieftain

cards.name: Kjeldoran Gargoyle
cards.text:
Flying, first strike
Whenever Kjeldoran Gargoyle deals damage, you gain that much life.
cards.flavor: The gargoyles were taken from the walls of flooded Kjeldoran cities and brought upland to guard the outposts of New Argive.

cards.name: Kjeldoran Javelineer
cards.text:
Cumulative upkeep {1} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
{T}: Kjeldoran Javelineer deals damage equal to the number of age counters on it to target attacking or blocking creature.

cards.name: Kjeldoran Outrider
cards.text: {W}: Kjeldoran Outrider gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "I listen to people. He sniffs the wind. And we both sense something big coming. Something very big."

cards.name: Kjeldoran War Cry
cards.text: Creatures you control get +X/+X until end of turn, where X is 1 plus the number of cards named Kjeldoran War Cry in all graveyards.
cards.flavor: King Darien's breath crystallized and fell to the frozen battlefield, but its command carried true to all soldiers of New Argive.

cards.name: Krovikan Mist
cards.text:
Flying
Krovikan Mist's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Illusions on the battlefield.
cards.flavor: Plague-induced dreams became real as they swirled above Krov, mingling with the magical residue of the World Spell.

cards.name: Krovikan Rot
cards.text:
Destroy target creature with power 2 or less.
Recover {1}{B}{B} (When a creature is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, you may pay {1}{B}{B}. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand. Otherwise, exile this card.)

cards.name: Krovikan Scoundrel
cards.flavor: The few surviving humans of Krov would have welcomed the return of winter and its sterilizing cold. They often peered northward, hoping that the snow's edge had reached their infested city-tomb.

cards.name: Krovikan Whispers
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Cumulative upkeep {U} or {B} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
You control enchanted creature.
When Krovikan Whispers is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, you lose 2 life for each age counter on it.

cards.name: Lightning Serpent
cards.text:
Trample, haste
Lightning Serpent enters the battlefield with X +1/+0 counters on it.
At the beginning of the end step, sacrifice Lightning Serpent.
cards.flavor: Ice exploded into steam in its wake, hissing like a thousand serpents hailing their blazing master.

cards.name: Lightning Storm
cards.text:
Lightning Storm deals X damage to target creature or player, where X is 3 plus the number of charge counters on it.
Discard a land card: Put two charge counters on Lightning Storm. You may choose a new target for it. Any player may activate this ability but only if Lightning Storm is on the stack.

cards.name: Lovisa Coldeyes
cards.text: Each creature that's a Barbarian, a Warrior, or a Berserker gets +2/+2 and has haste.
cards.flavor: "I lead my horde to the northwest. I won't return until the ice wizards fall and their fiendish contraptions are crushed!"

cards.name: Luminesce
cards.text: Prevent all damage that black sources and red sources would deal this turn.
cards.flavor:
"The White Shield is not the burnished metal you lash to your forearm but the conviction that burns in your chest."
—Lucilde Fiksdotter,
leader of the Order of the White Shield

cards.name: Magmatic Core
cards.text:
Cumulative upkeep {1} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
At the beginning of your end step, Magmatic Core deals X damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures, where X is the number of age counters on it.

cards.name: Martyr of Ashes
cards.text: {2}, Reveal X red cards from your hand, Sacrifice Martyr of Ashes: Martyr of Ashes deals X damage to each creature without flying.
cards.flavor: She turns ash into flame and burns enemies to ash.

cards.name: Martyr of Bones
cards.text: {1}, Reveal X black cards from your hand, Sacrifice Martyr of Bones: Exile up to X target cards from a single graveyard.
cards.flavor: Puppeteered by Heidar's icy hand, they were sacrificed to the Frost Marsh to raise Haakon's army.

cards.name: Martyr of Frost
cards.text: {2}, Reveal X blue cards from your hand, Sacrifice Martyr of Frost: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {X}.
cards.flavor:
"Do not call the Balduvians barbaric. Their magic is as potent as it is primal."
—Zur the Enchanter

cards.name: Martyr of Sands
cards.text: {1}, Reveal X white cards from your hand, Sacrifice Martyr of Sands: You gain three times X life.
cards.flavor: "Only in our vulnerability is there true power, and that power is life itself."

cards.name: Martyr of Spores
cards.text: {1}, Reveal X green cards from your hand, Sacrifice Martyr of Spores: Target creature gets +X/+X until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "Weep not for me. I will rise with the spring's new growth."

cards.name: Mishra's Bauble
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice Mishra's Bauble: Look at the top card of target player's library. Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
cards.flavor:
"Arcum is a babbling fool Phyrexian technology is our greatest blessing. Take this delightful trinket for instance . . ."
—Heidar, Rimewind master

cards.name: Mouth of Ronom
cards.text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{4}{S}, {T}, Sacrifice Mouth of Ronom: Mouth of Ronom deals 4 damage to target creature. ({S} can be paid with one mana from a snow permanent.)

cards.name: Mystic Melting
cards.text:
Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
cards.flavor: The sun-hot glow radiated from the druids, leaving scattered metal in steaming pools as it passed.

cards.name: Ohran Viper
cards.text:
Whenever Ohran Viper deals combat damage to a creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.
Whenever Ohran Viper deals combat damage to a player, you may draw a card.
cards.flavor: The ohran viper is not cold-blooded. Its veins course with the same antigelid venom used to kill its prey.

cards.name: Ohran Yeti
cards.text: {2}{S}: Target snow creature gains first strike until end of turn. ({S} can be paid with one mana from a snow permanent.)
cards.flavor: When a snowdrift shows you its eyes, it's already too late.

cards.name: Orcish Bloodpainter
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Orcish Bloodpainter deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
cards.flavor: Blood calls to blood.

cards.name: Panglacial Wurm
cards.text:
Trample
While you're searching your library, you may cast Panglacial Wurm from your library.
cards.flavor:
"Step lightly and we might be able to use it as a bridge."
—Ib Halfheart, goblin tactician

cards.name: Perilous Research
cards.text: Draw two cards, then sacrifice a permanent.
cards.flavor: When the School of the Unseen fell, so many magical treasures lay abandoned that no amount of death could deter the stream of thieves and desperate scholars.

cards.name: Phobian Phantasm
cards.text:
Flying; fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
Cumulative upkeep {B} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)

cards.name: Phyrexian Etchings
cards.text:
Cumulative upkeep {B} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
At the beginning of your end step, draw a card for each age counter on Phyrexian Etchings.
When Phyrexian Etchings is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, you lose 2 life for each age counter on it.

cards.name: Phyrexian Ironfoot
cards.text:
Phyrexian Ironfoot doesn't untap during your untap step.
{1}{S}: Untap Phyrexian Ironfoot. ({S} can be paid with one mana from a snow permanent.)
cards.flavor: It took the Rimewind cultists days to realize they had successfully activated the creature—it just wasn't interested in moving.

cards.name: Phyrexian Snowcrusher
cards.text:
Phyrexian Snowcrusher attacks each turn if able.
{1}{S}: Phyrexian Snowcrusher gets +1/+0 until end of turn. ({S} can be paid with one mana from a snow permanent.)
cards.flavor: Its plow wasn't designed for snow, but to carve a path through shrieking armies.

cards.name: Phyrexian Soulgorger
cards.text: Cumulative upkeep—Sacrifice a creature. (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
cards.flavor: The Phyrexian minds that constructed it did not live past its awakening.

cards.name: Resize
cards.text:
Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.
Recover {1}{G} (When a creature is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, you may pay {1}{G}. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand. Otherwise, exile this card.)

cards.name: Rime Transfusion
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+1 and has "{S}: This creature can't be blocked this turn except by snow creatures." ({S} can be paid with one mana from a snow permanent.)
cards.flavor: The unfortunates so transformed hungered not for flesh, but for warmth.

cards.name: Rimebound Dead
cards.text: {S}: Regenerate Rimebound Dead. ({S} can be paid with one mana from a snow permanent.)
cards.flavor:
"Tresserhorn is ours now. Dredge the lake and bring me all the bones you find. We'll build you a new army, the likes of which Terisiare has never seen."
—Heidar, Rimewind master, to Haakon

cards.name: Rimefeather Owl
cards.text:
Flying
Rimefeather Owl's power and toughness are each equal to the number of snow permanents on the battlefield.
{1}{S}: Put an ice counter on target permanent.
Permanents with ice counters on them are snow.

cards.name: Rimehorn Aurochs
cards.text:
Trample
Whenever Rimehorn Aurochs attacks, it gets +1/+0 until end of turn for each other attacking Aurochs.
{2}{S}: Target creature blocks target creature this turn if able. ({S} can be paid with one mana from a snow permanent.)

cards.name: Rimescale Dragon
cards.text:
Flying
{2}{S}: Tap target creature and put an ice counter on it. ({S} can be paid with one mana from a snow permanent.)
Creatures with ice counters on them don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.

cards.name: Rimewind Cryomancer
cards.text: {1}, {T}: Counter target activated ability. Activate this ability only if you control four or more snow permanents. (Mana abilities can't be targeted.)
cards.flavor: "The Thaw brings flooding, disease, and death. We will do all in our power to bring frigid peace back to the world."

cards.name: Rimewind Taskmage
cards.text: {1}, {T}: You may tap or untap target permanent. Activate this ability only if you control four or more snow permanents.
cards.flavor: "Find solace in the sun? Burning, blinding, laying secrets bare? No, solace is found under the blanket of cold."

cards.name: Rite of Flame
cards.text: Add {R}{R} to your mana pool, then add {R} to your mana pool for each card named Rite of Flame in each graveyard.
cards.flavor: Deep beneath the ice, beneath the soil and the rock, Dominaria's fire still burned hot.

cards.name: Ronom Hulk
cards.text:
Protection from snow
Cumulative upkeep {1} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)

cards.name: Ronom Serpent
cards.text:
Ronom Serpent can't attack unless defending player controls a snow land.
When you control no snow lands, sacrifice Ronom Serpent.
cards.flavor: With the spread of Rimewind's sorcerous winter, snow dwellers reclaimed their places atop the food chain.

cards.name: Ronom Unicorn
cards.text: Sacrifice Ronom Unicorn: Destroy target enchantment.
cards.flavor: The aberrant magic of the Rimewind drew the unicorns back from the northern wastes to do battle once again.

cards.name: Rune Snag
cards.text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {2} plus an additional {2} for each card named Rune Snag in each graveyard.
cards.flavor:
"Concentration is key. Without it, a mage conjures nothing but a splitting headache."
—Zur the Enchanter

cards.name: Scrying Sheets
cards.text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{1}{S}, {T}: Look at the top card of your library. If that card is snow, you may reveal it and put it into your hand. ({S} can be paid with one mana from a snow permanent.)

cards.name: Sek'Kuar, Deathkeeper
cards.text: Whenever another nontoken creature you control dies, put a 3/1 black and red Graveborn creature token with haste onto the battlefield.
cards.flavor: Karplusan legend told of an orc so cruel that he burned his own followers in rage—yet so revered that they rose from their pyres to serve him.

cards.name: Shape of the Wiitigo
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When Shape of the Wiitigo enters the battlefield, put six +1/+1 counters on enchanted creature.
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a +1/+1 counter on enchanted creature if it attacked or blocked since your last upkeep. Otherwise, remove a +1/+1 counter from it.

cards.name: Sheltering Ancient
cards.text:
Trample
Cumulative upkeep—Put a +1/+1 counter on a creature an opponent controls. (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)

cards.name: Simian Brawler
cards.text: Discard a land card: Simian Brawler gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"It's odd to see the apes rip down trees to arm themselves in defense of their forests."
—Taaveti of Kelsinko, elvish hunter

cards.name: Skred
cards.text: Skred deals damage to target creature equal to the number of snow permanents you control.
cards.flavor:
"This close to Rimewind Keep, no avalanche is nature's doing."
—Ukoten, centaur chieftain

cards.name: Soul Spike
cards.text:
You may exile two black cards from your hand rather than pay Soul Spike's mana cost.
Soul Spike deals 4 damage to target creature or player and you gain 4 life.

cards.name: Sound the Call
cards.text: Put a 1/1 green Wolf creature token onto the battlefield. It has "This creature gets +1/+1 for each card named Sound the Call in each graveyard."
cards.flavor:
"If you call the wolves, ensure you have a worthy hunt, or you may become the hunted."
—Taaveti of Kelsinko, elvish hunter

cards.name: Squall Drifter
cards.text:
Flying
{W}, {T}: Tap target creature.
cards.flavor:
"The scouts claim the cold has malice, and a mind. I begin to believe them. Impassable drifts seem to appear before us at every turn."
—Aevar Borg, northern guide, journal entry

cards.name: Stalking Yeti
cards.text:
When Stalking Yeti enters the battlefield, if it's on the battlefield, it deals damage equal to its power to target creature an opponent controls and that creature deals damage equal to its power to Stalking Yeti.
{2}{S}: Return Stalking Yeti to its owner's hand. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery. ({S} can be paid with one mana from a snow permanent.)

cards.name: Steam Spitter
cards.text:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
{R}: Steam Spitter gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Its belly produces a boiling-hot fluid it can spit as a weapon or spin slowly enough to freeze into a defensive web.

cards.name: Stromgald Crusader
cards.text:
Protection from white
{B}: Stromgald Crusader gains flying until end of turn.
{B}{B}: Stromgald Crusader gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "The White-Shielders think their code justifies their actions. In truth it only binds their hands."

cards.name: Sun's Bounty
cards.text:
You gain 4 life.
Recover {1}{W} (When a creature is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, you may pay {1}{W}. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand. Otherwise, exile this card.)
cards.flavor: "Heidar has forced the sun into hiding, but it has not forgotten us."

cards.name: Sunscour
cards.text:
You may exile two white cards from your hand rather than pay Sunscour's mana cost.
Destroy all creatures.

cards.name: Surging Æther
cards.text:
Ripple 4 (When you cast this spell, you may reveal the top four cards of your library. You may cast any revealed cards with the same name as this spell without paying their mana costs. Put the rest on the bottom of your library.)
Return target permanent to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Surging Dementia
cards.text:
Ripple 4 (When you cast this spell, you may reveal the top four cards of your library. You may cast any revealed cards with the same name as this spell without paying their mana costs. Put the rest on the bottom of your library.)
Target player discards a card.

cards.name: Surging Flame
cards.text:
Ripple 4 (When you cast this spell, you may reveal the top four cards of your library. You may cast any revealed cards with the same name as this spell without paying their mana costs. Put the rest on the bottom of your library.)
Surging Flame deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Surging Might
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2.
Ripple 4 (When you cast this spell, you may reveal the top four cards of your library. You may cast any revealed cards with the same name as this spell without paying their mana costs. Put the rest on the bottom of your library.)

cards.name: Surging Sentinels
cards.text:
First strike
Ripple 4 (When you cast this spell, you may reveal the top four cards of your library. You may cast any revealed cards with the same name as this spell without paying their mana costs. Put the rest on the bottom of your library.)

cards.name: Survivor of the Unseen
cards.text:
Cumulative upkeep {2} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
{T}: Draw two cards, then put a card from your hand on top of your library.

cards.name: Swift Maneuver
cards.text:
Prevent the next 2 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
cards.flavor: Darien's call to Yavimaya would have fallen red to the snow had it not been for the agility of the aesthir.

cards.name: Tamanoa
cards.text: Whenever a noncreature source you control deals damage, you gain that much life.
cards.flavor: When Freyalise spoke the World Spell, the tamanoa rose to bring a new morning to Terisiare.

cards.name: Thermal Flux
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Target nonsnow permanent becomes snow until end of turn.
• Target snow permanent isn't snow until end of turn.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

cards.name: Thermopod
cards.text:
{S}: Thermopod gains haste until end of turn. ({S} can be paid with one mana from a snow permanent.)
Sacrifice a creature: Add {R} to your mana pool.
cards.flavor: Slicking the ice with its heated underside, the thermopod skates at great speed to overtake its prey.

cards.name: Thrumming Stone
cards.text: Spells you cast have ripple 4. (Whenever you cast a spell, you may reveal the top four cards of your library. You may cast any revealed cards with the same name as the spell without paying their mana costs. Put the rest on the bottom of your library.)

cards.name: Tresserhorn Sinks
cards.text:
Tresserhorn Sinks enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {B} or {R} to your mana pool.
cards.flavor:
"Our land oppressed by silent Cold,
We weary wretches, young and old,
Pray that Springtime loose his hold."
—The Dynasty of Winter Kings

cards.name: Tresserhorn Skyknight
cards.text:
Flying
Prevent all damage that would be dealt to Tresserhorn Skyknight by creatures with first strike.
cards.flavor: Kjeldorans who fled battle were exiled to the wastes. Those who strayed near Tresserhorn were pressed into service in Haakon's army.

cards.name: Ursine Fylgja
cards.text:
Ursine Fylgja enters the battlefield with four healing counters on it.
Remove a healing counter from Ursine Fylgja: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to Ursine Fylgja this turn.
{2}{W}: Put a healing counter on Ursine Fylgja.

cards.name: Vanish into Memory
cards.text: Exile target creature. You draw cards equal to that creature's power. At the beginning of your next upkeep, return that card to the battlefield under its owner's control. If you do, discard cards equal to that creature's toughness.
cards.flavor: Out of sight, into mind.

cards.name: Vexing Sphinx
cards.text:
Flying
Cumulative upkeep—Discard a card. (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
When Vexing Sphinx dies, draw a card for each age counter on it.

cards.name: Void Maw
cards.text:
Trample
If another creature would die, exile it instead.
Put a card exiled with Void Maw into its owner's graveyard: Void Maw gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Wall of Shards
cards.text:
Defender, flying
Cumulative upkeep—An opponent gains 1 life. (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)

cards.name: White Shield Crusader
cards.text:
Protection from black
{W}: White Shield Crusader gains flying until end of turn.
{W}{W}: White Shield Crusader gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "Honor your steed and it will carry you to great deeds—and bring you home to tell of them."

cards.name: Wilderness Elemental
cards.text:
Trample
Wilderness Elemental's power is equal to the number of nonbasic lands your opponents control.
cards.flavor:
"Don't be so quick to reclaim the thawing lands. They might have acquired a taste for freedom."
—Taaveti of Kelsinko, elvish hunter

cards.name: Woolly Razorback
cards.text:
Woolly Razorback enters the battlefield with three ice counters on it.
As long as Woolly Razorback has an ice counter on it, prevent all combat damage it would deal and it has defender.
Whenever Woolly Razorback blocks, remove an ice counter from it.

cards.name: Zombie Musher
cards.text:
Snow landwalk
{S}: Regenerate Zombie Musher. ({S} can be paid with one mana from a snow permanent.)
cards.flavor: The World Spell thawed their icy graves, promising rest in soft, quiet earth at last. But Heidar called them to duty for a twisted cause.

cards.name: Zur the Enchanter
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Zur the Enchanter attacks, you may search your library for an enchantment card with converted mana cost 3 or less and put it onto the battlefield. If you do, shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: Zur remained aloof from Terisiare's suffering, intent only on his own perfection.
